newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Algar, 3 foreign firms plan cellular bid.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Algar, 3 foreign firms plan cellular bid.

text.p: Brazil's Algar group said it will join three foreign companies to form a consortium to bid on concessions to operate in the Band B cellular frequency.

The consortium will be made up of Algar's Lightel, Korea Mobile Telecom, Britain's Mobile System International and Japan's Kanematsu trading firm, Jose Mauro Leal Costa, Lightel's vice president, told reporters.
The stake each company will hold in the consortium has not been decided yet and a second Brazilian partner is being sought, Costa said.
"What is decided is that Lightel will control a majority of the voting shares," he said.
The group may spend up to $2 billion to operate one of 10 Band B concessions being offered by the Brazilian government starting next year.
